column1: Date of voluntary disclosure of errors
column2: Date of disclosure is within the 1 year grace period (i.e. anytime between 19 Apr 2023 and 18 Apr 2024)
column3: Date of disclosure is 1 year after the grace period (i.e. anytime between 19 Apr 2024 and 18 Apr 2025)
column4: Date of disclosure is 3 years after the grace period (i.e. anytime between 19 Apr 2026 and 18 Apr 2027)

column1: Amount of reduced penalties imposed (if any)
column3: A reduced penalty of $330 (5% X $6,600) will be imposed.
column4: A reduced penalty of $990 (5% X $6,600 X 3 years) will be imposed.
column5: withholding-tax-reporting-compliance             Example 2: Computation of reduced penalty on errors voluntarily disclosed by an individual in his Individual Income Tax Return within and after the grace period

column2: Mr Andrew voluntarily disclosed the errors within the 1-year grace period from the statutory filing deadline of 18 Apr 2023 and met all the qualifying conditions under the VDP. Hence, no penalty is imposed on error.
column3: Mr Andrew voluntarily disclosed the errors 1 year after the grace period ended on 18 Apr 2024. Hence, a reduced penalty of 5% of the tax undercharged was imposed.
column4: Mr Andrew voluntarily disclosed the errors 3 years after the grace period ended on 18 Apr 2024. Hence, a reduced penalty of 15% of the tax undercharged (i.e. 5% penalty for each year that the errors were late in being rectified) was imposed.
